body: Looks like it's only available in the golang v3 drive package: https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/api/drive/v3#FilesCopyCall.KeepRevisionForever
This was discussed [in the forum](https://forum.rclone.org/t/google-drive-revisions-control/3078) and the conclusion was the v2 API could pin things which is nearly as good.

Ok, reading the [Migration to v3 guide](https://developers.google.com/drive/v3/web/migration), it looks like pinned and keepRevisionForever are equivalent.

I think the flag should be `--drive-keep-forever` or `--drive-keep-revision-forever` so it matches the flag in the v3 API.

Implementing keepRevisionForever requires using the v3 drive API. #320 
Once we are using the v3 api, it's pretty easy to add a flag for it. (Two lines of code).

issue.title: WIP: Update drive use v3 API

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This is my current state of updating the drive API to v3 (#320)

It should be complete except for Google Docs exports with the vfs package.
The workaround using a HEAD request to determine the size of a exported file in the `Size()` method does not work anymore, because exports are now transferred using chunked-encoding. A solution could be to download the whole file to get the size, but this very expensive and there is no guarantee the content does not change between exports.
Exports using basic operations like copy will succeed nonetheless.

All other tests are passing fine.
